{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient has severe acne vulgaris that has not responded to oral antibiotics and topical combination therapy. The physician has decided to start her on combined oral contraceptive pills. These pills are often used in women to treat acne by reducing the levels of androgens, which can decrease sebum production and improve acne. Combined oral contraceptives have also been shown to reduce the risk of ovarian cancer.
